image.altText: Images of four victims in shooting attack at Bondi including 10 year-old girl and two rabbis.

props.synopsis: Fifteen people have died, including a 10-year-old girl, after a terror attack on a Jewish festival at Sydney's Bondi Beach. One of two alleged gunmen has also died, while a further 42 people were taken to hospital. Follow live.

title.children: Vigils held for Bondi terror victims

image.altText: The old bank at the township of Snowtown.

props.synopsis: Snowtown serial killer James Vlassakis will remain behind bars, after the South Australian Parole Board's decision to release him was overturned.

title.children: Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis to remain behind bars

image.altText: Crime scene tape outside a home.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 37-year-old man for the alleged murder of a woman who was found unresponsive in Adelaide's parklands in January.

title.children: Man charged with alleged murder of woman in Adelaide's parklands

image.altText: Exterior of a modern hospital

props.synopsis: The number of critical patients having to travel interstate to receive CAR T-cell therapy will be reduced from mid-next year, with SA to launch a service at the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

title.children: Cutting-edge cancer therapy coming to South Australia from mid-2026

image.altText: Nathan Lyon looks to his left while wearing cap

props.synopsis: For the first time in an age Nathan Lyon is not an automatic selection in the Test side but the returning off spinner insists he has nothing to prove ahead of the upcoming clash with England in Adelaide.

title.children: Why Nathan Lyon believes he has nothing to prove on Test return

image.altText: GettyImages-2251821666

props.synopsis: With England pinning its hopes on victory in the third Test, the tourists have been warned that the Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks.

title.children: Data shows Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks for England

image.altText: A group of students in maroon uniforms sit in a circle on grass

props.synopsis: Kanyanyapilla means "place of many eagles", and it's where Indigenous students in Adelaide are coming to connect with Kaurna culture.

title.children: 'Sentimental and special': Students find connection through Kaurna program

image.altText: A man in a mechanic workshop holding an axe, with cars being repaired behind him

props.synopsis: Kahu Woolley was clinically dead multiple times, but quick actions by his friends brought him back.

title.children: Axeman brought back to life after mid-competition heart attack

image.altText: Auburn and yellowish green orchid in the shape of a duck head with wings stretched out behind it

props.synopsis: Two centuries after orchids were first documented in South Australia, photographers are still discovering new plants.

title.children: Native orchids captivate photographers in search of undiscovered bush treasure

image.altText: A black and white photo of a house with fallen bricks in front.

props.synopsis: Adelaide sits on the most active seismic zone in Australia and has more than its fair share of tremors below magnitude-4, but it's been 71 years since it was rocked by a serious earthquake. Now, it's a matter of when, not if, it gets another one.

title.children: Is Adelaide due for another big earthquake?

image.altText: A woman dressed in a protective helmet lays under stalactites in a cave

props.synopsis: It was an adventure into the unknown. From the surface all that could be seen was a small opening. The ABC has been given exclusive access to newly-discovered caves on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

title.children: Phoenix cave 'rises from the ashes' amid discovery after KI bushfires

image.altText: mother hugs child closely

props.synopsis: This is what psychologists have to say about approaching the subject with children.

title.children: Psychologists on talking to kids about the Bondi beach shooting

image.altText: A collage of photos of Alice Wilkinson with friends and family, centered on a large black and white photo of Alice.

props.synopsis: Alice Wilkinson loved music and was the life of the party. Her death has prompted her family to help others who might be struggling.

title.children: Alice took her own life at 13. Now her family is fundraising to help others

image.altText: Rob Reiner at a premiere with his wife Michele.

props.synopsis: Rob Reiner, known for directing When Harry Met Sally... and A Few Good Men, was found dead alongside his wife inside their Los Angeles home.

title.children: Deaths of When Harry Met Sally director Rob Reiner and wife investigated as homicide

image.altText: An image of a bushfire at nighttime burning amongst tall trees. A firetruck is off to the side.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's emergency warning system fails as multiple bushfires threaten lives and homes in the state's south.

title.children: Multiple emergency bushfires blazing across WA as website crashes

image.altText: Headshot selfie of a woung woman wearing glasses

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old man admits killing Perth lawyer Alice McShera, whose body was found in a hotel room in the upmarket Crown Towers complex in 2023.

title.children: Courtroom packed as man admits murdering Perth lawyer at upmarket hotel

image.altText: Image of an incinerated bedroom, including a bed, in Guildford.

props.synopsis: A NSW inquest has been told exploding lithium-ion batteries caused volatile fires killing three people in separate blazes within minutes.

title.children: NSW inquest told how exploding lithium-ion batteries turned deadly

image.altText: A close up of a Hong Kong man wearing a green face mask being escorted by police.

props.synopsis: Jimmy Lai, a former Hong Kong media mogul and one of the city's most outspoken critics of China, has been found guilty of sedition and collusion in a landmark national security case that has drawn international scrutiny.

title.children: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai found guilty of sedition and collusion

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: ASX bosses say they are committed to reform after the corporate regulator lashes the operator's failings in a report, saying it underestimates long-term problems, is insular and defensive with deficiencies in culture and leadership.

title.children: Shares in stock exchange operator ASX fall after damning inquiry

image.altText: luger1

props.synopsis: Australian luger Alex Ferlazzo pulls off a miracle recovery after falling off his sled halfway through a run.

title.children: Australian luger makes stunning recovery mid-run after falling off sled

image.altText: police

props.synopsis: Police say they are responding to a crash that has claimed the lives of four people near Cobram in Victoria's north.

title.children: Breaking: Four dead, five hospitalised after minivan crash in Victoria's north

image.altText: A group of formally dressed people smile and hold trophies in celebration in a group portrait on the edge of a stage.

props.synopsis: ABC journalist Adele Ferguson is among three directors who have resigned from the board of Australia's most prestigious journalism awards over governance issues.

title.children: Three independent directors of the Walkley Foundation resign over reform stoush

image.altText: A serving bowl of pearl couscous salad with pomegranate, leafy greens and a tangy dressing.

props.synopsis: Summer is the season for salad, and in that spirit, we've gathered seven of our finest together for you.

title.children: Punchy, bright and crunchy: Here are seven salads for summer

image.altText: A bald man with a neck tattoo exits a prison van on his way to the Supreme Court

props.synopsis: A judge says the offending of a man found guilty of kidnapping a Victorian 19-year-old, who was later murdered, was "spontaneous" and "born of panic".

title.children: Man convicted of kidnapping 19yo Charlie Gander now eligible for parole

image.altText: A water truck pumping water at Quinninup townsite.

props.synopsis: Quinninup and Northcliffe in Western Australia's south-west receive an average of 1 metre of rain every year, so why has the state government spent millions of dollars trucking in drinking water?

title.children: The state government has trucked water to WA's wettest towns for 15 years

image.altText: an aerial photo of road trains lined up next to a set of cattle yards, with yellow grasslands behind.

props.synopsis: Consolidated Pastoral Company spends more than $300 million to buy the Beetaloo aggregation of stations in the NT.

title.children: Beetaloo Station sold in historic $300m deal to CPC

image.altText: Dolphin Sands bushfire emergency,

props.synopsis: A bushfire in Tasmania that destroyed 19 homes was caused by a registered burn conducted about a week earlier, which was not extinguished by a landowner, authorities have confirmed.

title.children: Bushfire caused by burn-off not extinguished properly

image.altText: A baby lays on the edge of a bed.

props.synopsis: A man charged over a crash that killed a one-month-old baby on the Gold Coast has been granted bail following an 11-week police investigation.

title.children: Man charged over newborn's death in Gold Coast M1 crash granted bail

image.altText: Candles burn at Bondi following the attack.

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns urges community members wanting to help the Jewish community following the Bondi terror attack to donate blood.

title.children: 'We are here for you': How to help in the wake of the Bondi attack

image.altText: tim nicholls in a hard hat and hi-vis vest

props.synopsis: The Queensland LNP government says it aims to roll out 2,600 new hospital beds across the state by 2032 at a cost of about $18.5 billion.

title.children: Qld hospital bed timeline reveals some upgrades pushed to 2032

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue lab clothing look at a brain scan on a computer.

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest brain research centre is suing one of its executives, alleging he deleted troves of commercially sensitive information during a midnight incursion at its Melbourne laboratory.

title.children: Brain research centre sues executive, alleging he stole and erased files

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations

props.synopsis: There doesn't seem to be much political mileage for the government to do anything at all — whether that is cracking down and forcing cannabis users back onto the black market or fully legalising the substance.

title.children: Australia's medicinal cannabis situation is unattractive for politicians

image.altText: 2025-11-17T125307Z_741427822_RC2CYHAFXUU6_RTRMADP_3_UKRAINE-CRISIS-FRANCE-MACRON

props.synopsis: Ukraine relinquishes its plan to join the NATO military alliance in exchange for Western security guarantees as it seeks an end to the war with Russia.

title.children: Ukraine drops ambition to join NATO ahead of peace talks

image.altText: Michelle Rowland gives a press conference.

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland is told to repay a portion of travel expenses she claimed for a 2023 family trip to Perth.

title.children: Attorney-general to repay family travel expenses
